title: Electric field from nonuniform charge distribution

content.question: The volume charge density for a sphere of radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is directly related to the radius of the sphere as given by the equation <math alttext="rho as a function of lowercase r, equals b lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ρ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive integer. Which of the following is a correct expression for the electric field for the sphere at a distance <math alttext="lowercase r equals one half times uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from its center?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with the numerator b uppercase R squared and the denominator 4 epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi><msup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with the numerator b uppercase R squared and the denominator 16 epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi><msup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with the numerator b and the denominator 2 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with the numerator b and the denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with the numerator b and the denominator 8 pi epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with the numerator b uppercase R squared and the denominator 16 epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi><msup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
